terms.definition: Research and Development - the process of investigating and developing new products, processes, or technologies to drive innovation and competitive advantage
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A single, unified location where all documents, data, and resources are stored and managed, providing consistent access across teams
The systematic process of capturing, organizing, storing, and sharing information and expertise within an organization
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously work on and edit the same document with changes visible instantly to all participants
Intellectual Property - legal rights that protect creations of the mind, including patents, trademarks, and proprietary processes in business
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
Pre-designed document formats that provide a standardized structure and layout for consistent documentation creation
The use of technology to automatically execute repetitive documentation tasks and processes without manual intervention
Groups of people with different functional expertise working together toward a common goal, requiring coordinated documentation practices
The practice of protecting digital information from unauthorized access, corruption, or theft through various technical and administrative measures
The process of connecting different software tools and platforms to work together seamlessly, sharing data and functionality
The adherence to laws, regulations, standards, and internal policies that govern how documentation must be created and maintained
The ability to track and document the history, application, or location of items through recorded identification and documentation
A software solution specifically designed to create, manage, organize, and publish various types of technical and business documentation
